data.title: List of March for Our Lives locations (2022)
data.text: State Cities Photo Approximate attendance Notes 40,000[2][3] National Mall, near the Washington Monument;[4] organizers planned for as many as 50,000.[3] Scheduled speakers included March for Our Lives co-founders and Parkland survivors X Gonz√°lez and David Hogg, DC Mayor Muriel Bowser,[5] US Rep. Cori Bush (D-MO), AFT President Randi Weingarten, Yolanda Renee King, granddaughter of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr, and Garnell Whitfield, son of a Buffalo shooting victim and a retired Buffalo fire commissioner.[1][6] Alabama Birmingham 150-200[7] Kelly Ingram Park Foley 30[8] Foley Heritage Park Huntsville 30+[9] rally and march held at Big Spring Park[10] Montgomery 40[11] Alabama State Capitol[12] Alaska Eagle River 4[13] Eagle River Town Square Soldotna 25[14] sidewalk in front of Soldotna Creek Park, on Sterling Hwy Arizona Flagstaff 30+[15] lawn of Flagstaff City Hall[16] Payson 8[17] parking lot fronting MobileT/The Beverage Place, E State Highway 260[16] Phoenix 3,000[18] - 5,000[19] Hundreds gathered outside the Arizona State Capitol (in 114-degree heat), then marched through the streets.[19] State Rep. Jennifer Longdon made an appearance in support of the event.[20] Less than a dozen counter-protesters were also present.[2][18] Prescott 150+[21] Mile High Middle School - Yavapai County Courthouse Plaza;[21][22] state Sen. Martin Quezada spoke at the event.[23] Sedona 22[24] candlelight vigil held at Jack Jamesen Memorial Park;[16] US Rep. Tom O'Halleran was present.[24] Tucson hundreds[25] A rally was held at Armory Park,[26] ending with a candlelight vigil to honor victims of gun violence, including those lost in Tucson on January 8.[27] Arkansas Little Rock 200[28] Arkansas State Capitol;[29][30] attendees included state Sen. Clarke Tucker, state Reps. Fred Love and Andrew Collins, state Senate candidate David Barber and gubernatorial nominee Chris Jones.[28] California Anaheim 500[31] Pearson Park[32] - Anaheim City Hall Arcata ~65[33] Arcata Plaza (grassy knoll) - Arcata Playhouse Auburn 100+[34] Auburn Courthouse, Maple St Benicia 300[35] Benicia Green, corner of First & B Streets - march up and down First Street[36] Burbank 300+[37] Chandler Bike Path[38] - W Chandler Blvd & N Mariposa St;[39] US Rep. Adam Schiff and Burbank Mayor Jess Talamentes both spoke at the rally and participated in the march.[37][40] Burlingame hundreds[41] A rally was held at Burlingame City Hall,[42][43] followed by a march down Burlingame Ave.[44] Carpinteria[45] 60[46] corner of Linden Ave & Carpinteria Ave Culver City 40+[47] Veterans Memorial Park,[39] corner of Culver Blvd & Overland Ave.[48] Culver City Mayor Daniel Lee[49] and council member Yasmine-Imani McMorrin[48][50] spoke at the event. Encinitas 100+[51] Moonlight Beach Encino 200[52] Hundreds marched around and rallied at all four corners of Ventura Blvd & Hayvenhurst Ave.[39] Fresno 100+[53] River Park, SE Corner of Nees and Blackstone[54] Fullerton 50+[55] Hillcrest Park, 1200 N Harbor Blvd[32] Grass Valley dozens[56] Grass Valley Veterans Memorial Building, 255 South Auburn St[57] Hesperia event planned outside US Rep. Jay Obernolte‚Äôs Hesperia office, 7th Ave[58] Idyllwild 20+[59] Flagpole in town center[58][60] La Ca√±ada Flintridge[61] 150[62] La Ca√±ada Memorial Park;[32] state Sen. Anthony Portantino spoke at the rally.[62] Laguna Beach 80+[63] rally held at Main Beach Park, S Coast Hwy;[31][32] state Sen. Dave Min addressed the crowd.[63] Long Beach 300[31] Harvey Milk Promenade Park - Gov. George Deukmejian Courthouse[39] Los Angeles thousands[32] The rally took place in Grand Park, followed by a march on surface streets around LA City Hall.[64] A second LA event took place at UCLA around the Bruin Bear Statue at Westwood Plaza.[32] Manhattan Beach 200[65] Manhattan Beach Pier[32] - Hermosa Beach Pier.[31] Speakers included Assemblymember Al Muratsuchi.[66] One counter-protester briefly interrupted the rally before being escorted away.[65] Monterey couple hundred[67] Window on the Bay[67] Mountain View 250+[68] Gateway Park, W El Camino Real[69] Nevada City event planned at Broad Street Bridge[70] Oakland 700[71] Frank H. Ogawa Plaza Ojai 40-60[72] Libbey Park Entrance, Ojai Ave[58] Pacifica 100+[73] Linda Mar Beach parking lot - Rockaway Beach Trail[74] Palm Springs 60+[75] Frances Stevens Park; Palm Springs Mayor Lisa Middleton and congressional candidate Will Rollins spoke to the crowd.[75] Event hosted by the Desert Stonewall Democrats.[76] Palmdale event planned at Rancho Vista Blvd & 10th St West, 39605 10th St W[32] Pasadena few hundred[77] Pasadena City College[31] - march downtown[78] Redlands 200[79] Ed Hales Park, 5th & North St - march downtown; US Rep. candidate Derek Marshall attended the event.[79] Redwood City 100+[80] Redwood City Public Library - march downtown.[81] San Carlos Mayor Sara McDowell spoke at the rally.[68] Riverside 350[31] Galleria Mall at Tyler Sacramento hundreds[82] (6/2) student walkout outside McClatchy Senior High School;[82] (6/11) event planned,[83] but cancelled due to extreme heat.[84] San Clemente event planned at San Clemente Public Library, 243 Avenida Del Mar[85] San Diego hundreds[51][86] A rally and march was held outside the San Diego County administration building;[87] US Rep. Scott Peters spoke at the rally. In City Heights, dozens honored victims at Jeremy Henwood Memorial Park.[51] San Francisco hundreds[88] San Francisco City Hall[89] San Jose event planned at San Jose City Hall[90] San Leandro event and march planned at Root Park, 1033 E 14th Street[91] (but later changed to Oakland) San Luis Obispo event planned[45] San Marcos event planned at CA-78[92] Santa Ana[55] 60+[93] Centennial Regional Park[58] Santa Clarita 40-60[94] Valencia Blvd and Magic Mountain Parkway[39] Santa Cruz 120[95] Santa Cruz Clock Tower[96] - Pacific Ave; the rally and march went ahead peacefully, in spite of (and unbeknownst to participants) the fact that organizers had failed to get a march permit in time and officially cancelled the event.[95] Santa Maria 50[45] One Community Action office, East Fesler St - Santa Maria City Hall[45] Santa Monica 70-100[97] Aero Theater, Montana Ave[39] - Santa Monica State Beach[98][99] Sonoma 100[100] Sonoma Plaza Tehachapi 50[101] corner of Tucker Rd (Hwy 202) & Valley Blvd; a few pro-gun activists also showed up.[101] Temecula[102] TBD event held at Temecula Duck Pond, Ynez And Rancho California[58] Thousand Oaks 300[103] Marchers headed up Thousand Oaks Boulevard from Westlake Promenade[32] to Thousand Oaks Civic Arts Plaza.[104] US Rep Julia Brownley greeted the participants.[105] Ventura 0 event originally planned at Ventura City Hall, but later merged with Thousand Oaks & Westlake Village[106] Visalia[107] 32[108] Memorial Park, 107 N Hall St - march down Main St to Church St[108] Walnut Creek 175+[109] Civic Park; US Rep Eric Swalwell spoke to the crowd.[109] Woodland Hills 80-100[110] Warner Park, Topanga Canyon Blvd[39] Yucca Valley 11[111] Morongo Basin MFOL; event held at NE corner of Old Woman Springs Road & Twentynine Palms Highway (Hwys 247 & 62)[112] Colorado Colorado Springs 200[113] People gathered outside US Rep. Doug Lamborn's 5th congressional district office on Kelly Johnson Blvd.[114] Cortez 25[115] corner of Montezuma Ave & Market St. Denver hundreds[116] Civic Center Park;[117] in addition to multiple speakers, including State Sen. Tammy Story and US Rep. Diana DeGette, there was an 11-minute moment of silence for the victims of the recent Uvalde, Texas, school shooting.[118][119] Durango 100[120] People marched from Durango High School parking lot on Main Ave to Durango Public Library,[121] whence a forum was held with three Democratic candidates (Adam Frisch, Sol Sandoval & Alex Walker) running for Colorado's 3rd Congressional District primary.[120] Edwards dozens[122] Edwards main roundabout, Edwards Access Blvd Fort Collins 400+[123] Old Town Square Glenwood Springs 60[124] Sayer Park - Centennial Park Grand Junction few dozen[125] Old Mesa County Courthouse Lawn, & 6th Rood Ave[126] Longmont 200+[127] Hundreds marched down Main St to Longmont Civic Center at 3rd Ave and Kimbark St; participants and speakers included Longmont Mayor Joan Peck, state Rep. Karen McCormick and state Sen. Sonya Jaquez Lewis.[128] Pueblo 30-50[129] Dozens gathered along U.S. 50 and Elizabeth St, outside the Old Northside Kmart parking lot, to advocate for gun reform.[129] Parker 5[130] Fika Coffee House Ridgway 50[131] Hartwell Park - Ridgway Town Park, Lena St[132] Steamboat Springs 28[133][134] Routt County Courthouse lawn[135] Connecticut Hartford hundreds[136] Bushnell Park; US Sen. Richard Blumenthal and Lt. Gov. Susan Bysiewicz spoke at the rally.[136][137] Litchfield 15[138] Litchfield High School[139] New Haven (event planned)[140] Newtown 400[141] Hundreds gathered outside Newtown Middle School; speakers included teenagers Jessica Eisele[142] and Ashley Hubner, town residents and survivors of the 2012 Sandy Hook School shooting.[141][143] The group then marched onto Main St and headed down to the National Shooting Sports Foundation building, where they were greeted by US Sen. Richard Blumenthal.[144] Salisbury[145] 300[146] Salisbury Town Green, in front of the White Hart Inn, Rtes 41 & 44 - library[147] Stamford several dozen[148] Mill River Park; Stamford Mayor Caroline Simmons spoke at the rally.[148] Torrington 6[139] Torrington City Hall Westport 85+ (total) (6/8) Stand Up Against Gun Violence march, organized by the group Westport Moms, was held along Main St (50+ people);[149] (6/11) A few dozen people marched from Jesup Green[150] to the Ruth Steinkraus Cohen Bridge[151] Delaware (online) (6/2) The Delaware State Education Association held a "Virtual Vigil for School Safety" on a Thursday night[152] Florida Babcock Ranch event planned at Babcock Ranch Founders Square (Punta Gorda)[153] Boynton Beach event planned at 7675 Trapani Lane[153] Bradenton 60[154] - 70[155] Riverwalk Splash Park - Manatee County courthouse; event organized by Women's Voices of Southwest Florida[156] Coral Gables 200-300[157] Coral Gables City Hall; Miami-Dade County Mayor Daniella Levine Cava spoke at the rally.[158] Flagler Beach 60[154] Demosntrators lined up along the west side of State Road 100, outside Wadsworth Park.[159] Fort Myers 400+[160] Old Lee County Courthouse, Main St[161] - march downtown[162] Gainesville 300[163] Bo Diddley Plaza - Depot Park[154][164] Inverness 15[165] Citrus County Courthouse, U.S. 41 Jacksonville event planned on Jacksonville beaches[166] Jensen Beach / Stuart 60-100[167] Roosevelt Bridge, Federal Hwy[166][168] Key West[166] at least 5[169] A rally was held at Bayview Park, along Truman Ave; state Rep candidate Adam Gentle was present.[169] Largo event planned at 601 Starkey Rd[170] Leesburg event planned at US-441 in front of Lake-Sumter College[166] Melbourne 300[171] Hundreds showed up for a rally and march at West Melbourne Community Park.[154] Ocala 10[172] intersection of Silver Springs Blvd (State 40) and Pine Ave (US Route 441)[166] Orlando thousands[173] Orlando City Hall[174] - Lake Eola.[175] Speakers included state Reps. Anna Eskamani & Carlos Guillermo Smith,[173] and Orlando's incoming police chief Eric Smith.[176] Palmetto Bay event planned at Coral Reef Park[153] Parkland[157] 1,500[177] Pine Trails Park Amphitheater[178] Pensacola 150[179] Dozens gathered at Plaza Ferdinand VII, then marched downtown along Palafox St.[180][181] Port Orange 100-125[159] corner of U.S. 1 & Dunlawton Ave.[182] Sarasota 100+[183] Hart's Landing - John Ringling Causeway Bridge Sebring event planned at Democratic Headquarters, Sebring Pkwy[166] St. Augustine 100+[184] In spite of rain, dozens showed up at the lawn of Castillo de San Marcos.[185][186] St. Petersburg several hundred[187] Hundreds gathered and marched at North Straub Park;[188] event hosted by the Women's Advocacy Movement of Pinellas (WAMP).[189] Local elected officials and political candidates were invited to the event, but not allowed to speak, only listen.[190] Tallahassee 60-75[191] Florida State Capitol Building Tampa hundreds[189] George E. Edgecomb Courthouse[189] - march down E. Twiggs St to Curtis Hixon Waterfront Park[192] Weston[193] hundreds[157] Weston Regional Park[194] Georgia Athens 30[195] Athens City Hall[196] Atlanta[197] 1,000+[198] Ebenezer Baptist Church[4] - Edgewood Ave - Woodruff Park;[199] US Reps Nikema Williams[200] & Lucy McBath[4][201] took part in the march. Augusta 100+[202] People lined both sides of Walton Way Extension, outside the Unitarian Universalist Church.[203] Columbus 80[204] Dozens gathered at the Mall on Broadway, 11th St & Bwy;[205] 2 counter-protesters also showed up.[204] Gainesville ~125[206] protest held at Gainesville Square[205] Louisville 3[207] Jefferson Hospital, Peachtree St[205] Marietta 200[208] Marietta Square[205] Savannah 100-150[209] A rally was held at Daffin Park,[210] focusing not only on gun control but also reproductive rights and voting rights. Governor hopeful Stacey Abrams made a surprise appearance, alongside Savannah Mayor Van Johnson.[209] Snellville few dozen[211] Snellville Towne Green, Main St. East[201][205] Hawaii Honolulu 30+[212] Waikiki Post Office[213] - march downtown[212] Lihue 10+[214] Kauai Community College Entrance[215] Idaho Boise 500[216] Hundreds gathered for a rally at the Idaho State Capitol,[217] while across the street, 60-100 counter-protesters stood in Cecil D. Andrus Park.[218] Ketchum 100[219] Ketchum Town Square - march downtown[220] Lewiston 50[221] A vigil was held at Brackenbury Square, Main St;[222] a handful of pro-gun-rights counterprotesters also turned out.[221] Illinois Bloomington 75[223] McLean County Museum of History Charleston 60+[224] Coles County Courthouse (north side), 651 Jackson Ave[225] Chicago 1,000[226] Federal Plaza;[227] speakers included state Rep. Denyse Wang Stoneback and U.S. Rep. Marie Newman.[226] Crystal Lake 50+[228] corner of Exchange Drive & Northwest Highway;[229] US Rep. Bill Foster spoke to the crowd.[228] DeKalb nearly 200[230] Band Shell at Hopkins Park[231] - march north up Sycamore Road to Greenwood Acres Drive and back[230] Downers Grove 200-300[232] Hundreds turned out at Downers Grove North High School parking lot[232] for a rally and march downtown.[233] US Rep. Sean Casten spoke at the event.[232] Elgin 100+[234] corner of Kimball Street and Grove Avenue[229] Highland Park 150[235] - 500[236] Sunset Woods Park[229] - march through downtown.[235] Three weeks later, the city suffered its own mass shooting during an Independence Day parade, with seven people killed and at least 38 injured.[237] Naperville 25[238] (5/28) Statue by the YMCA - Central Park, S Washington St Palatine hundreds[232] Margreth Riemer Reservoir[229] Springfield hundreds[239] Old State Capitol St. Charles 80-100[240] A rally and march was held at Lincoln Park;[229] state Representative candidate Arad Boxenbaum addressed the crowd.[240] Indiana Bloomington 100[241] - 250[242] Monroe County Courthouse[243] - march along Kirkwood Ave[241][244] Columbus 200[245] Columbus City Hall, Washington St[246] Evansville[247] event planned[248] Fort Wayne 45[249] Allen County Courthouse Indianapolis few hundred[250] Tarkington Park[251] - Indiana Governor's Mansion;[247] state Sens. J.D. Ford & Fady Qaddoura were in attendance.[250] Lafayette[251] 65-75[252] Tippecanoe County Courthouse - farmer's market[253] South Bend[254] 350[255] Morris Performing Arts Center, John R. Hunt Plaza[256] - South Bend courthouse;[255] state Rep. Maureen Bauer was present.[247] Iowa Ames 50[257] Tom Evans Plaza - Bandshell Park / Dog-Eared Books, Main St[258] Cedar Rapids 150[259] Greene Square Park - downtown march[260] Davenport hundreds[261] Vander Veer Botanical Park Des Moines hundreds[262] (6/10) Central Library, Cowles Commons - People's Plaza outside Iowa State Capitol[263][264] Indianola event planned by Indivisible Warren County at Moats Park[265] Iowa City 35[266] (6/13) College Green Park, University of Iowa - The Pentacrest[267] Sioux City 50+[268] Woodbury County Courthouse - Public Museum[269] Storm Lake dozens[270] march around Storm Lake Elementary School Kansas Wichita 200[271] Dozens gathered at Old Town Square.[272] Interim Wichita Police Chief Lem Moore spoke at the rally.[273][274] Kentucky Bowling Green 4[275] event held at Warren County Justice Center[276] Frankfort 150+[277][278] People held a rally on the front steps of the Kentucky State Capitol.[279][280] Lexington 40-50[281] (6/3) Fayette County Courthouse Louisville hundreds[282] Hundreds gathered at Louisville Metro Hall,[283] then marched along Jefferson Ave to Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Plaza, corner of 6th & Chestnut Streets[284] (location of Sen. Mitch McConell's office). Participants in the march included Louisville Mayor Greg Fischer,[285] US Rep. John Yarmuth,[286] US Senate candidate Charles Booker[287] and mayoral candidate Craig Greenberg (who months earlier had survived an assassination attempt during his campaign).[288] Hours after the event, five teenagers were injured in a shooting near the Big Four Bridge in Louisville.[287] Louisiana Baton Rouge 25[289] Louisiana State Capitol Eunice 50-75[290] A family of a slain man, Donovan Reed, began their 2nd Annual Gun Violence Walk and Vigil, starting at the downtown location where he was murdered in 2021, and heading to Eunice City Hall. Eunice Mayor Scott Fontenot lent his support.[290] New Orleans 120+[291] "Peace Up Guns Down" rally and procession held at Treme Recreation Center[292] Maine Belfast 100+[293] Post Office Square, Franklin St Blue Hill 75[294] Blue Hill Town Hall, front lawn Bucksport dozens[295] Veterans Memorial Park (Pine St)[296] & Eastern Channel Bridge[295] Falmouth TBD Maine Gun Giveback 2022;[297] event held at Falmouth Maine Police Department and led by the Maine Gun Safety Coalition.[298] Ten city police departments across the state of Maine participated.[299] Farmington 10[300] rally held along Main St, outside Hippach Field[301] Machias event planned at Bad Little Falls Bridge[299] North Berwick 17[302] North Berwick Center & Town Hall[303] Portland 1,000+[304] Hundreds gathered at Lincoln Park (Congress St & Pearl St), then marched through the Old Port before arriving at Portland City Hall.[305][306] Rockland 100[307] Chapman Park, Park & Main Streets - march downtown; Speakers included state Reps. Vicki Doudera and Rep. Ann Matlack.[307] Scarborough event planned at Memorial Park[299] Maryland Annapolis 200+[308] rally held at The People's Park;[309] speakers included Andrea Chamblee, widow of late Capital Gazette journalist John McNamara, who was killed in a June 2018 mass shooting.[308] Baltimore 50+[310] Pierce's Park[311] - McKeldin Plaza - Baltimore City Hall;[312] former US Secretary of Education and candidate for Governor of Maryland John King Jr. spoke to the crowd.[313] Chestertown 100+[314] County building, 400 High St[315] - Wilmer Park; former Republican US congressman (& current Democrat) Wayne Gilchrest spoke at the event.[314][316] Cumberland 23[317] Allegany County Courthouse on Washington St[318] - City Hall Park[319] Ocean City 15-20[320] People stood along Rte 50 at West Ocean City Park 'n Ride.[315][321] Reisterstown 60[322] Franklin High School[315] - Franklin Middle School[322] Massachusetts Amherst ~16[323][324] Kendrick Park, N Pleasant St[325] Andover 30+[326] Shawsheen Square;[327] state Rep. Tram Nguyen attended the rally.[326] Boston thousands[328][329] Christopher Columbus Waterfront Park (North End);[330] Mayor of Salem, MA Kim Driscoll (whose city cancelled their MFOL event)[331] attended the Boston rally.[332] Greenfield 110[333] (6/9) On Thursday, dozens of Four Rivers Charter Public School students staged a walkout, heading west to the adjacent Greenfield Community College campus, to protest gun violence.[333] Meanwhile, the official "March for Our Lives ‚Äì Anti Gun Violence Rally," scheduled for Saturday June 11 at noon on the Greenfield Town Common, was canceled so as not to conflict with the Franklin County Pride March.[325] Haverhill dozens[334] Whites Corner, intersection of Water & Main Sts, in front of Market Basket;[327][335] candidate for Massachusetts Attorney General Quentin Palfrey attended the rally.[336][337] Ipswich dozens[338] Ipswich Center Green[327] Longmeadow 50+[339] Bay Path University - Longmeadow Town Green[339] Nantucket 45+[340] Nantucket Methodist Church[340][341] Northampton several hundred (5/31) On Tuesday afternoon, over half the student body at Northampton High School walked out their classrooms and gathered outside the building's front doors for an after-school protest against gun violence.[342] Salem few dozen+ (6/1) Salem Teachers Union held a city-wide peaceful protest of nation-wide gun violence in schools; a few dozen faculty at Collins Middle School banded together outdoors and entered their building en-masse.[343] Wareham 200[344] People lined Route 6 in front of Wareham Memorial Town Hall;[327] 21 empty chairs sat on the town hall lawn to honor the students and teachers killed in Uvalde, TX.[341] Michigan Ann Arbor 400+[345] The Diag, University of Michigan;[346][347] US Rep. Debbie Dingell spoke at the event.[345] Cassopolis 5[348] Clisbee Park, N Broadway & School St (near St. Ann Catholic Church) - beach pavilion[348] Dearborn Heights ~20 (6/10) community candlelight vigil held at Islamic House of Wisdom[349] Detroit 500+[350] Detroit Cities Riverfront; speakers included US Reps Andy Levin & Rashida Tlaib, and State Sens. Stephanie Chang & Rosemary Bayer.[351] Farmington Hills 50+[352] Nardin Park United Methodist Church[353][354] Grand Haven 100-120[355] Central Park[356] Grand Rapids 50+[357] (6/18) Veteran's Memorial Park;[358] US Rep. candidate Hillary Scholten attended the event.[359] Lansing 500[350][360] Hundreds gathered at the Michigan State Capitol;[361] among the speakers were Gov. Gretchen Whitmer, US Sen. Debbie Stabenow, Atty Gen. Dana Nessel, US Rep Elissa Slotkin and Lansing Mayor Andy Schor.[350][362] Oxford 400[363] - 600[364] Centennial Park, S Washington St[354] - Oxford High School; rally and march planned by No Future Without Today, a group of students of said school, where a gunman killed four people and injured seven back in November 2021.[365] Michigan Atty Gen. Dana Nessel appeared at the rally for support.[363] Port Huron 50[366] Pine Grove Park - Port Huron City Hall & Municipal Office Center; rally organized by St. Clair County Democratic Party[367] St. Joseph 100[368] People stood outside Rep. Fred Upton's St. Joseph office on Main St.[254] Traverse City 300[369] Grandview Parkway and Union Street, 3840 Blueberry Ln[370] Waterford 12[371] Civic Center Pond[354] Minnesota Albert Lea dozens[372] Freeborn County Courthouse, S Broadway Ave Brainerd 60+[373] Gregory Park - historic water tower at N 6th & Washington Sts Grand Marais 25[374] Grand Marais Harbor Park, W Wisconsin St Minneapolis 500[375][376] intersection of 12th & Washington Aves - Minneapolis City Hall[377] Rochester 200[378] Peace Plaza, 1st Ave SW - Olmsted County Government Center St. Cloud 75[379] Stearns County Courthouse and Jail[380] St. Peter 30[381] Gault Park Pavilion Mississippi Jackson 80[382] Mississippi State Capitol[383] Oxford 75[384] Oxford City Hall, Oxford City Square[385] Tupelo 20+[386][387] Fairpark[386][388] - Gateway Park[389] Missouri Kansas City 350[390] Hundreds gathered at Gillham Park; Kansas City Mayor Quinton Lucas spoke at the rally.[391] Rolla 50[392] Phelps County Courthouse, N Main St - Rolla City Hall; a few Democratic candidates for office, including event hosts Randi McCallian (US Rep), Bernadette Holzer (state Rep) and Tara Anura (state Senate) spoke at the rally.[392] Springfield 30[393] (6/10) Park Central Square St. Joseph 25+[394] (6/12) prayer vigil at Civic Center Park St. Louis 300[395] - 600[396] Kiener Plaza - march down Market St in downtown St. Louis[397] Montana Kalispell event planned at Depot Park[398] Missoula 70+[399] People gathered at Missoula County Courthouse on W Broadway St (in the rain).[399] Whitefish 7[400] Armory Park - Depot Park Nebraska Chadron 6[401] Chadron Middle School, 6th & Ann Sts - Dawes County Courthouse lawn[402] Kearney[403] 30[404] Harmon Park - march to Walgreens via 5th Ave and Hwy 30[405] Lincoln 70+[406] (6/4) Nebraska State Capitol; state Sen. Adam Morfeld spoke at the rally.[407] Omaha 300+[408] A rally was held at Memorial Park; state Senator and candidate for Nebraska's 2nd congressional district Tony Vargas addressed the crowd.[409] After the rally, people walked down to Dodge St to hold up signs.[410] Nevada Las Vegas 100[411] rally held at Sunset Park, E Sunset Rd Reno 80[412] Reno City Plaza[413] New Hampshire Littleton 100[414] Walgreens Intersection (Rt. 302 & Dells Rd)[415] Nashua 250+[416] Soldiers and Sailors Monument[327] - Greeley Park;[417] US Sen. Maggie Hassan[418] and state Rep. Laura Telerski (D-Hillsborough)[416] were among the speakers. New Jersey Asbury Park 30[419] Springwood Park (formerly Sunset Park); the rally and march got under way but ultimately had to be rescheduled for June 30 (for proper paperwork to be filed).[419] Atlantic City 60[420][421] Atlantic City Boardwalk[422] Hackensack 80-100[423] Bergen County Courthouse; US Rep. Josh Gottheimer[424] and US Sen. Bob Menendez[425] spoke at the rally. Hackettstown[426] 100+[427] rally and march launched at Hackettstown High School[428] Jersey City[426] 46[429] (6/12) Pedestrian Mall, Newark Ave[419] - Journal Square[430] Montclair (6/3) St. James Church (front lawn), Valley Rd[431] Newark hundreds[432] A rally was held at Military Park, followed by a march down Broad Street;[432] speakers included Montclair, NJ Mayor Sean Spiller, US Sen. Bob Menendez,[433] state Senate Majority Leader Teresa Ruiz[432] and US Rep. Donald Payne Jr.[434] Ocean City hundreds[435] Ocean City Boardwalk, Stenton Place & 23rd Street[422] - Welcome Center via 9th St Bridge[435] Princeton 350[436] Hinds Plaza, Witherspoon Street;[437] US Rep. Bonnie Watson Coleman spoke at the rally.[436] Ramsey event planned at Ramsey Municipal Building, N Central Ave[438] Roselle[426] 100+[439] Warinanco Park;[440] former state Sen. Raymond Lesniak[433] and former assemblyman Jamel Holley[439] spoke at the rally. Sewell 0 (6/25) event planned at Washington Towmnship Park, Hurffville Crosskeys Rd[440] (but canceled)[441] Somerville 300[442] Somerset County Courthouse[433] Springfield / Union[426] 120+[443] Springfield Town Hall, Mountain Ave - Union High School Football Field, Morris Ave.[444] US Rep. Tom Malinowski spoke at the rally in Springfield; respective Mayors Alex Keiser and Manny Figueiredo carried a banner in the march to the latter's town, where both of them spoke along with other elected officials.[445] Toms River 100[446] Huddy Park[440][447] New Mexico Albuquerque TBD Due to extenuating circumstances, the official Saturday event planned for Civic Plaza[448] was canceled several weeks in advance.[449] However, New Mexicans to Prevent Gun Violence hosted a buyback event, "Guns to Gardens," at Mesa Presbyterian Church, where 240 firearms were donated, cut apart and repurposed as garden tools.[450] Clovis march planned: Greene Acres Lake - Main Street - Clovis-Carver Public Library parking lot[451] Farmington 13[452] Orchard Plaza Park, Main St and Orchard Ave Roswell 36[453] Roswell Independent School District Administrative and Educational Services Complex, North Kentucky Ave - Pioneer Plaza, N Main St New York Albany hundreds[454] West Capitol Park; Lt. Gov. Antonio Delgado spoke at the rally[455] and joined the march.[4][454] Other elected officials at the event were Albany Mayor Kathy Sheehan and US Rep. Paul Tonko.[456] Beacon[457] dozens[458] rally held at Main St[459] Buffalo hundreds[460] People marched down Jefferson Avenue to the Tops Friendly supermarket where 10 people were killed on May 14th,[461] stopped by the memorial site and gathered in a field to honor the victims.[462] Corning 45[463] Corning-Painted Post High School - Centerway Square;[464] US Rep. candidate Max Della Pia spoke at the rally.[464] Cornwall 100[465] Riverlight Park[459] - Bandstand at Hudson St & River Ave[466] Elmira few dozen[463] Riverside Elementary School - Brand Park.[463] This rally mostly consisted of teachers who attended a previous rally in Corning, NY, plus one of said rally's speakers, US Rep. candidate Max Della Pia.[464] Geneseo 200[467] Geneseo Village Park - march up and down Main St[468] Great Neck 300[469] Jonathan L. Ielpi Firefighters Park, Grace Avenue & Park Place Ithaca 13[470] Ithaca Commons[471] Mineola several hundred[472] Nassau County Supreme Court[473] - Nassau County Legislature Building, Franklin Ave[472] New Paltz 20-30[474] TOPS shopping center plaza - march down Main St to a vigil at Elting Memorial Library & back;[475] US Rep. candidate Pat Ryan[474] attended the event. New York City 1,000[4] Cadman Park Plaza, Brooklyn - Brooklyn Bridge[476] - Washington Square Park; participants included NYC Mayor Eric Adams[477] & NY Atty Gen.
